page.title: 01Orchardleigh Park
page.content:
The park land is nearly all pasture with just a few trees to shelter the cows. The land slopes down to the lake. This is quite large with reeds and bullrushes growing around it. There is a ruined boat house next to a boggy area. At one side there is an island joined by a bridge to the park. On the island is an old church. Nearby, are a few cottages. A large part of the park is woodland. This is mainly deciduous with oak, beech, ash, horse chestnut and sycamore. Many pheasants and other game birds are bred for a local shooting syndicate. There are lots of footpaths leading through the park.
by James Lawrence, Stuart Humphreys & Lee Curtis (10)
